bibl.author: Reuben Farwell
bibl.title: Reuben Farwell to Walt Whitman, 2 October 1864
bibl.orgName: Trent Collection of Whitmaniana, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

revisionDesc.change: corrected orgName, added pbs, added choice tags, corrected opener

body.p: Yours I recivedreceived several weeks ago. Though I have been quite unwell like your self This makes the fourth week I have been out of the Service of Uncle Sam I hardly know what to write you at present because I do not know wetherwhether you ever will recivereceive it or not. I am some better than I was when I arrived here
I trust that you will excuse me in not writing you before
Though I tried to find out by the Boys in Armory where you were But they could not tell
Now Uncle if you will (not) Answer this after My being detained in getinggetting yours from the Regt. I belonged to too this place
I least I hope you will Try and give me a Reply
I trust that this may find you well and in better health than when you wrote me last. I will answer All enquireysenquiries from you. this from one who would like to see you Indeed
